question: Which country houses the UNESCO World Heritage Site "Monastery of Nea Moni of Chios"?
explanation: Nea Moni is an 11th-century monastery on the island of Chios, Greece, that has been recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is located on the Provateio Oros Mt. in the island's interior, in Chios town. It is well known for its mosaics, which, together with those at Daphni and Hosios Loukas, are among the finest examples of "Macedonian Renaissance" art in Greece.
